intro: Canthium telidosma, commonly known as the African eggplant, is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its egg-shaped fruits that are typically covered in a rough, spiny husk. The plant produces showy yellow flowers and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forested areas. The fruit is edible when ripe, though it is typically used in traditional medicine and local cuisines.
